creator: petermac@threerock.com
text:
The httpd.conf file has a default user/group value of
User nobody
Group #-1


When attempted to run on a Linux/Unix type system without modification, this 
causes errors to be written to logs/error_log
[alert] (22)Invalid Argument: setgid: unable to set group id to <nnnnn>

Just a thought but if the User is set to nobody by default, should the Group 
value not also be.

Thanks

Peter Mac Giollafhearga

creator: rbb@apache.org
text:
Unfortunately, there really isn't a good value that is available on all 
platforms.  Previous versios of RedHat Linux used to include a -1 user, 
but that was removed.  I am marking this bug as WONTFIX, because there is
no good solution.

Thank you for using Apache.
